Combat - Decent not great.
Good enemy amount - Better ally amount. 
Tedious - Extremely tedious levelling and swapping out to new allies - Glory system made that extra tedious.

Been spending 6 hours in the same desert now just fighting the same enemies over and over. Even if the enemies are different these fights feel the same. I got maybe a little bit of story, so too boring to continue.

i tried so hard to justify spending $60 on this but having to slog through the areas (open world and especially demon king's castle) are the most repugnant abhorrent incomprehensibly dogshit sections of any game to have ever been made i have played and i have played xenosaga episode 2. the combat is so cool but story uninteresting, the music is neat but the characters don't exist, the nahobino is hot but will metaphor is hotter

Kinda regret buying this game.

I thought they improved since SMT 3 but it still the same pattern. 
The pacing in this game is horrible in modern day RPG. You enter a big world, you fight nonstop until you reach a checkpoint storyline, you continue fighting immediately.
There is no hub for you to release tension. You have to be caution all the time, and manually save every 5min yourself because one bad encounter then you are dead.

Even when i have overleveled my character, i can die to some random bullshit like Mudoon hit enemy and instant kill mc or entire party get one shot by red berserk enemy. I could easily kill that berserk monster if my bar is full, but i just take the shortcut since i'm overleveled at that point, thinking it should be a breeze fight, and now i lost 30min of progression. 


If they allow us to save everywhere, why not just put auto save feature to prevent such bullshit scenario. 

Need to remind myself don't ever buy SMT game in future

I liked the concept of the game‚Äîit was fun for the first couple of hours‚Äîbut after that it just became boring for me. I‚Äôm not saying it‚Äôs a bad game, it‚Äôs just not for me. I really tried to enjoy it, but I kept falling asleep and even accidentally beat a boss just by mashing buttons half-asleep. The game feels too easy, even on hard mode, since you can grind to a high level very early and breeze through most of it.
I‚Äôm a big fan of Persona and Persona-like games, so I had high hopes, but this one felt like a letdown. None of the characters stood out to me except for the saint girl and the second arc, which were the only parts I found interesting. Beyond that, the experience was just dull.

I know this is my personal opinion since most of the people are ecstatic about this game (95% positives), even though many mentioned that the plot is a LITTLE weak. When i started the game i felt it was okay, but at the mark of 3 hours exactly i understood i can't bear it anymore, the plot is NOT a LITTLE weak, it's DOGSHIT. 
Nothing happens for hours, you are forced to farm same mobs forever to attain lvl's for getting better ones to progress, barely any dialogues are recorded and you are just reading text, while the same phrases like "YOUNG MAN" get itched onto your brain. People mentioned good OST. Oh REALLY? The same track plays in literally every battle you start. And oh i mean it. Every. One.
I read that this game lacks the link system like in persona games and thought that it might be interesting to not spend as much time talking, heh, but i was so wrong. The lack of relevant dialogues with companions only enforces this feeling of never ending grind. Changing the team doesn't change the feeling of being in the same fight for hours on end - same strategies (only differently packaged), same annoying OST and same YOUNG MAN phrase every 2nd minute.
I forced myself to play for 3 more hours to see if maybe it gets better. No, it did not. I really wish i could refund this, but i can't. 
So i'm warning some guy stumbling on my review (which is unlikely to happen) to steer away. If you are a fan of Persona games - stick to them. SMT5V is a downgrade in all the possible ways from them. Perhaps i somehow misunderstood the game or was too rash in my judgement, but for me these 6 hours were nothing but one big annoyance (and i say it as Persona 3 and 5 fan).
This game has no challenge because you can save at almost any time before every battle
If you expect Persona, this one is not for you and me
A really great dungeon crawler that unfortunately devolves into a morass of uninteresting exposition and cutscenes. Even the dungeon crawling eventually turns into FFXIII corridor simulator... sad.
A addicting, super fun game. Until it just doesn't store any of your saves for the last 12 hrs of gameplay and completely stops your playthrough making you never play it again.

As a newcomer to SMT, I had a good time messing around, learning the system and exploring the demon designs, until the novelty wore off and I realised that A) there's so much QoL polish that the actual stakes of random encounters are about zero, and B) the base game has nothing for a plot.  There's a big hole where all the writing should be.  I see other reviewers saying that the new route has a better story; if you're planning on picking up this game, you're not missing anything by ignoring the original route.  If you're still worried, skip the tedium take 30 seconds of your life to read a plot synopsis.

The side quests have a bit more charm to them, but that's not saying much.  Most of the styling starts and ends at "what if this mythic figure was foul-mouthed and menial".  I hope you weren't expecting lore, either.

Despite the series reputation, this game is honestly pretty easy; playing on Normal, I've not had to worry about resource management or grinding since hour 1, and even superbuffed Ishtar only required fusing a couple of demons to crumple her like a paper cup.  You can't increase the difficulty after starting so you might want to start on Hard to see how it goes.

There are some genuinely charming demon designs here, but also a surprising number of scantily-clad women who think you're hot shit and need your approval.  It's clear that part of their QoL was aimed at making the demons into proper co-travellers with personalities you'd care about, but the combination of poor scaling + limited part space + one-demon-per-species limit + fusion system hobbles them in that regard.  You'll have to melt down your darlings to free up space, and churn through demons if you have any interest in exploring the fusion roster once it starts to bloat.

Mediocre. The gameplay is engaging enough for a RPG, but the characters and storyline are painfully lacking, even in the remake's improved story. Good for wasting time grinding, but thoroughly forgettable.

You can't increase the difficulty after starting so you might want to start on Hard to see how it goes.

There are some genuinely charming demon designs here, but also a surprising number of scantily-clad women who think you're hot shit and need your approval.  It's clear that part of their QoL was aimed at making the demons into proper co-travellers with personalities you'd care about, but the combination of poor scaling + limited part space + one-demon-per-species limit + fusion system hobbles them in that regard.  You'll have to melt down your darlings to free up space, and churn through demons if you have any interest in exploring the fusion roster once it starts to bloat.

Mediocre. The gameplay is engaging enough for a RPG, but the characters and storyline are painfully lacking, even in the remake's improved story. Good for wasting time grinding, but thoroughly forgettable.

Story - What would you do if you ended up being god.
Pagan gods are sick and tired of being beneath the Christian stories. Slow story and very lackluster... A basic what if twist on the Christianity stories. And the game says its purely fiction :'D
Combat - Decent not great.
Good enemy amount - Better ally amount. 
Tedious - Extremely tedious levelling and swapping out to new allies - Glory system made that extra tedious.

Been spending 6 hours in the same desert now just fighting the same enemies over and over. Even if the enemies are different these fights feel the same. I got maybe a little bit of story, so too boring to continue.

i tried so hard to justify spending $60 on this but having to slog through the areas (open world and especially demon king's castle) are the most repugnant abhorrent incomprehensibly dogshit sections of any game to have ever been made i have played and i have played xenosaga episode 2. the combat is so cool but story uninteresting, the music is neat but the characters don't exist, the nahobino is hot but will metaphor is hotter

Kinda regret buying this game.

I thought they improved since SMT 3 but it still the same pattern. 
The pacing in this game is horrible in modern day RPG. You enter a big world, you fight nonstop until you reach a checkpoint storyline, you continue fighting immediately.
There is no hub for you to release tension. You have to be caution all the time, and manually save every 5min yourself because one bad encounter then you are dead.

Even when i have overleveled my character, i can die to some random bullshit like Mudoon hit enemy and instant kill mc or entire party get one shot by red berserk enemy. I could easily kill that berserk monster if my bar is full, but i just take the shortcut since i'm overleveled at that point, thinking it should be a breeze fight, and now i lost 30min of progression. 


If they allow us to save everywhere, why not just put auto save feature to prevent such bullshit scenario. 

Need to remind myself don't ever buy SMT game in future

I liked the concept of the game‚Äîit was fun for the first couple of hours‚Äîbut after that it just became boring for me. I‚Äôm not saying it‚Äôs a bad game, it‚Äôs just not for me. I really tried to enjoy it, but I kept falling asleep and even accidentally beat a boss just by mashing buttons half-asleep. The game feels too easy, even on hard mode, since you can grind to a high level very early and breeze through most of it.
I‚Äôm a big fan of Persona and Persona-like games, so I had high hopes, but this one felt like a letdown. None of the characters stood out to me except for the saint girl and the second arc, which were the only parts I found interesting. Beyond that, the experience was just dull.

I know this is my personal opinion since most of the people are ecstatic about this game (95% positives), even though many mentioned that the plot is a LITTLE weak. When i started the game i felt it was okay, but at the mark of 3 hours exactly i understood i can't bear it anymore, the plot is NOT a LITTLE weak, it's DOGSHIT. 
Nothing happens for hours, you are forced to farm same mobs forever to attain lvl's for getting better ones to progress, barely any dialogues are recorded and you are just reading text, while the same phrases like "YOUNG MAN" get itched onto your brain. People mentioned good OST. Oh REALLY? The same track plays in literally every battle you start. And oh i mean it. Every. One.
I read that this game lacks the link system like in persona games and thought that it might be interesting to not spend as much time talking, heh, but i was so wrong. The lack of relevant dialogues with companions only enforces this feeling of never ending grind. Changing the team doesn't change the feeling of being in the same fight for hours on end - same strategies (only differently packaged), same annoying OST and same YOUNG MAN phrase every 2nd minute.
I forced myself to play for 3 more hours to see if maybe it gets better. No, it did not. I really wish i could refund this, but i can't. 
So i'm warning some guy stumbling on my review (which is unlikely to happen) to steer away. If you are a fan of Persona games - stick to them. SMT5V is a downgrade in all the possible ways from them. Perhaps i somehow misunderstood the game or was too rash in my judgement, but for me these 6 hours were nothing but one big annoyance (and i say it as Persona 3 and 5 fan).
This game has no challenge because you can save at almost any time before every battle
If you expect Persona, this one is not for you and me
A really great dungeon crawler that unfortunately devolves into a morass of uninteresting exposition and cutscenes. Even the dungeon crawling eventually turns into FFXIII corridor simulator... sad.
A addicting, super fun game. Until it just doesn't store any of your saves for the last 12 hrs of gameplay and completely stops your playthrough making you never play it again.

As a newcomer to SMT, I had a good time messing around, learning the system and exploring the demon designs, until the novelty wore off and I realised that A) there's so much QoL polish that the actual stakes of random encounters are about zero, and B) the base game has nothing for a plot.  There's a big hole where all the writing should be.  I see other reviewers saying that the new route has a better story; if you're planning on picking up this game, you're not missing anything by ignoring the original route.  If you're still worried, skip the tedium take 30 seconds of your life to read a plot synopsis.
